verses.roman:
strī-nāma śuni' prabhura bāhya ha-ilā
punarapi sei pathe bāhuḍi' calilā

synonyms: strī-nāma—the word "woman"; śuni'-hearing; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; bāhya—external consciousness; ha-ilā—returned; punarapi—again; sei pathe—on that path; bāhuḍi' calilā—He turned back.
translation: As soon as He heard the word "woman," the Lord became externally conscious and turned back.
